THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ASSIST THE GOVERNMENT OF JORDAN (GOJ) WITH IMPLEMENTING AND ENFORCING ITS LEGAL-REGULATORY FRAMEWORK GOVERNING THE LICENSING OF STRATEGIC TRADE AND CONDUCTING RELATED OUTREACH TO INDUSTRY.
GUIDE WB6 PARTNERS THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF ACTIVITIES REQUIRED TO BRING THEIR REGULATIONS INTO ALIGNMENT WITH THE EUROPEAN UNION (EU) STANDARDS

THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO ENGAGE SELECT AFRICAN PARTNERS TO BUILD NATIONAL BORDER-SECURITY CAPACITY IN KEY JURISDICTIONS, WITH A GOAL OF STOPPING CROSS-BORDER TRANSFERS OF PROLIFERATION-RELATED EXPERTISE.
TO MAKE INFORMATION ABOUT COMPLEX NONPROLIFERATION SANCTIONS MORE READILY AVAILABLE TO OFFICIALS IN PARTNER COUNTRIES.

THIS PROJECT WILL UNDERTAKE AN AWARENESS RAISING CAMPAIGN FOR MINING, FOREIGN TRADE, AND CUSTOMS AUTHORITIES IN INDONESIA TO HIGHLIGHT THE ECONOMIC AND NATIONAL SECURITY RELATED APPLICATIONS OF LITHIUM-ION BATTERIES AND PREVENT EXPLOITATION.
TO CREATE A TRAINING PROGRAM EDUCATING EXBS PARTNERS ON THE NATIONAL SECURITY RISKS RELATED TO CONDUCTING BUSINESS WITH PRC-AFFILIATED ENTITIES IN EMERGING TECHNOLOGY SECTORS.
TO EXPAND AND DIVERSIFY THE COMMUNITY WORKING TO COUNTER PROLIFERATION-RELATED NETWORKS AND ACTIVITIES OF MALIGN STATE ACTORS, THROUGH A STRUCTURED SMALL-GRANTS PROGRAM IN PARTNER COUNTRIES.
THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ANALYZE SEVERAL ANALYTICAL OUTPUTS: THE FIRST WILL EXAMINE GOODS AND TECHNOLOGIES SOUGHT BY PAKISTAN IN SUPPORT OF ITS MISSILE PROGRAM.
THIS PROJECT AIMS TO STRENGTHEN FINANCIAL SECTOR ADHERENCE TO THE FATF INTERNATIONAL STANDARDS FOR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF TARGETED FINANCIAL SANCTIONS AND COUNTERING PROLIFERATION FINANCE (CPF).

RESEARCH WORLDWIDE FDI REGULATIONS AND IMPLEMENTATION TRENDS, DEVELOP A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE INTERPLAY BETWEEN INVESTMENT SCREENING AND EXPORT CONTROLS AUTHORITIES, IDENTIFY BEST PRACTICE MODELS, AND DEVELOP AND PUBLISH AN FDI SCREENING PRIMER.
THIS PROJECT FOCUSES ON ASSESSING AND MITIGATING RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH VIRTUAL ASSETS FOR FIJI, PALAU, THE REPUBLIC OF THE MARSHALL ISLANDS, SAMOA, AND TONGA.
DEVELOP AND PILOT A TRAINING MODULE ON UAV-SPECIFIC STRATEGIC TRADE CONTROLS AND BEST PRACTICES IN THEIR IMPLEMENTATION.
PROVIDE A FOUNDATION ON WHICH TO BUILD PARTNER COUNTRY IMPLEMENTATION OF EFFECTIVE CONTROLS AGAINST CARBON FIBER TECHNOLOGY TRANSFERS.

AS EXBS LOOKS TO AMPLIFY ITS REMOTE TRAININGS IN LIBYA, EXBS REQUIRES AN IMPLEMENTER TO OVERSEE THE REPAIR AND OUTFITTING OF THE LIBYAN CUSTOMS COLLEGE. THIS WOULD ENCOURAGE AND ENABLE LIBYAN CUSTOMS TO HOST REMOTE TRAININGS.

THE INTERNATIONAL BORDER GUARD TRAINING PROGRAM IS AN ONGOING INTERAGENCY EFFORT TO JOINTLY TRAIN KEY BORDER SECURITY PERSONNEL FROM IRAQ AND JORDAN ON THE SKILLS NECESSARY TO EFFECTIVELY SECURE NATIONAL BORDERS ON THE FRONTIER BETWEEN POINTS OF ENTRY.
TO CONTINUE THE BIENNIAL PPI SERIES IN TRACKING PERFORMANCE AND PROGRESS MADE BY 200 COUNTRIES, ENTITIES, AND TERRITORIES INCLUDING ALL 57 EXBS PARTNERS AND PRIORITY COUNTRIES AS OF FISCAL YEAR 2021.
TO HARMONIZE THE LATEST EU DUAL-USE CONTROL LIST WITH THE ARMENIAN CONTROL LIST AND TARIFF CODES.
HARMONIZE THE LATEST EU DUAL-USE CONTROL LIST WITH THE ARMENIAN CUSTOMS TARIFF CODES, TO BE PRESENTED TO THE GOA FOR FURTHER IMPLEMENTATION.
